entry.title: photograph three cats flying through the air (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before photographer Philippe Halsman decided to photograph three cats flying through the air (pictured), surrealist artist Salvador Dalí had wanted to blow up a duck with dynamite?

entry.title: Jack Washburn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jack Washburn was called "Cinderella Boy" for winning a starring role in his first Broadway show?

entry.title: India national team were victorious (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the India national team were victorious in football at the 1951 and 1962 Asian Games?

entry.title: Bob Albright (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bob Albright won his first primary election for the Alabama House of Representatives against a neighbor who lived on the same street as him?

entry.title: Capitol Hill mystery soda machine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the allegedly haunted Capitol Hill mystery soda machine "went for a walk" one day and never returned?

entry.title: Mary Creighton Bailey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that teacher Mary Creighton Bailey was awarded the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany for her services in the improvement of education in Germany shortly after World War II?

entry.title: a winter storm in December 2017 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a winter storm in December 2017 cancelled an attempt at the world's largest snowball fight at Six Flags Great Adventure in New Jersey?

entry.title: a competing restaurant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Colonel Sanders created a competing restaurant to KFC, and was sued by KFC?
